column4: hi, i have ubuntu 7.04 with gnome and networkmanager, and for some reason my wireless doesnt work. i dont know if i have the driver, does anyone know how to add it on a normal dell inspiron with intel?
get to a terminal, type lspci
select its output and put it in a pastebin
get all that?
here's your problem: Broadcom Corporation Unknown device 4328 (rev 01)
if that's indeed your wireless card
and I'm pretty sure it is
its not an intel
intel cards are seen by the kernel just fine
broadcom's on the other hand........ are EVIL
and DON'T work
(no open source driver that fully works)
ok... scoping out info on that model
thanks i really appreciate it
WHICH e1505 ... I see 3 listed here: http://www.dell.com/content/products/features.aspx/cto_inspn_e1505?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs
yeah.... its got to be the dell one
I've got an intel 3945abg..... worked out of box from dapper on up
yeah my friends worked fine, his intel prosetwireless one
and was recognized by the kernel as exactly what it is
closed source driver... but WORKING driver
lets see what we can do to get you set up
someone's probably duct-taped some solution together for this dell card
scoping out now
